Package view

Class ValidateCommandView

java.lang.Object
view.ValidateCommandView
public class ValidateCommandView
extends java.lang.Object
This class is used to validate entered command. It will check if a command is valid for current phase and it will also check the syntax and number of parameters passed.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    ValidateCommandView()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int checkCommand​(GameEngine p_gameEngineObject, java.lang.String p_command, Player p_player)
    This functions is used to check if the base command is valid or not
    int validateSubCommands​(java.lang.String[] p_commandParameters, CommandList p_mainCommand)
    This function is used to traverse through all the sub-commands for a specific main command and return 0 if any sub-commands or number of parameters passed for each sub-command is incorrect.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • ValidateCommandView

      public ValidateCommandView()

  • Method Details

    • checkCommand

      public int checkCommand​(GameEngine p_gameEngineObject, java.lang.String p_command, Player p_player)
      This functions is used to check if the base command is valid or not
      Parameters:
      p_gameEngineObject - The object of GameEngine class
      p_command - The command entered by user
      p_player - The player who issued the command
      Returns:
      Greater than 1 if valid else 0

    • validateSubCommands

      public int validateSubCommands​(java.lang.String[] p_commandParameters, CommandList p_mainCommand)
      This function is used to traverse through all the sub-commands for a specific main command and return 0 if any sub-commands or number of parameters passed for each sub-command is incorrect. Otherwise it returns 1
      Parameters:
      p_commandParameters - list of all the sub-commands
      p_mainCommand - Enum pointer that corresponds to the main command
      Returns:
      Integer 0 if validation fails or 1 if it passes
